website_summaries.verdict: While it has its limitations, the Venture 2 is a good choice for wearing in windy, rainy conditions or layering with other jackets.
pros: An excellent choice for all-year wear
Can easily be layered with other clothing and jackets thanks to the relaxed fit
cons: Too thin to wear by itself in cold temperatures
Sizes run on the small side
Limited availability in some colors and sizes

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit alert!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item, seller: Champaign Surplus, and it is an obvious counterfeit. Poor quality seams, zipper very stiff, it was lacking the holographic sticker, the logo stitching is off, am terribly disappointed. It does not have laundry information label, nor season/year label which are things upon contacting The North Face confirmed this is not their product at all.
customer_reviews.author: geimVEIRA

customer_reviews.title: North Face, Can't Go Wrong
customer_reviews.text: You simply cannot go wrong with North Face. We have purchased NF for our daughter every year for Back to School shopping. Living in the Seattle area you need a good rain jacket. We like the weight of the jacket and the air venting is cool under the arm pits. The vents can be unzipped. Everything arrived as expected and within the timeframe expected. The fit is great and has room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: This is a good short rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is a good short rain jacket. Wanted something light weight and easy to fold for travel. Only negative for me is I find the crinkly noise it makes due to the fabric a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: lucygretajonas

customer_reviews.title: Good for spring or summer rainstorms
customer_reviews.text: Ordered size up after reading reviews because I wanted to be able to layer a sweatshirt underneath. Kept me dry in downpours at Universal Studios. Light weight enough so will not be sweating, but not a winter or cold weather rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Gym mom

customer_reviews.title: Product used
customer_reviews.text: Product used but sold by new, had no labels, a broken pocket, closures do not work and dirty. Xcess Limited It is not a reliable store
customer_reviews.author: Jc

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket! I looked everywhere for this particular style ( The North Face Women's Venture 2 Jacket ). Everywhere I went I could not find this style in black. I finally found it and at a great price too! It is the perfect fall or spring jacket and I ordered a larger size than normal so I could fit a sweatshirt or sweater under it on colder days! I will probably purchase the other colors in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Aunna

customer_reviews.title: Great rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: My favorite rain jacket...although I do wish it had the armpit vents because it can get a little toasty! Before even wearing the jacket I knew it was great..I washed in the washing machine and let it air dry on the counter. When I came back (I didn’t realize) there was a puddle on the ground and I almost slipped in it LOL. As for actually wearing it outside, the water just sheds right off. Does exactly what it’s supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: Taange

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: There are no issues with quality of the jacket – it is well made like any other North Face products. However, there 2 things that I did not like and that is why I have returned it back. 1) lining of the jacket is made of “polyurethane-coated inner layer that allows water vapor to escape” (from description) – meaning when you put on the jacket and lining touches your skin it feels as if you are wearing a plastic bag (very unpleasant and unnatural feel) and 2) the jacket is very noisy when you move.
customer_reviews.author: Alex PA

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Works well in the rain. I bought it to replace my other NorthFace raincoat and expected it to be lightweight, breathable and have the mesh material inside. This one reminds me of a child's raincoat on the inside (rubber/vinyl feeling), and is stiff. It is stylish and has kept me dry. In the "Pro" column on this one vs my old one, the hood has a little extra room for when my hair is pulled back. A full pony still causes the hood to fall backwards but not as bad as a normal hood.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: superb quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the second North Face rain jacket I have owned. My first one lasted well over 14 years, and being a school teacher, it was shoved in bags, hung on my chair, tied around my waist and thrown in the closet. I was so sad when I had to just trash it a couple of months ago. Living on the Gulf Coast, the humidity is horrible and I can't possibly wear a heavy raincoat. This one is lightweight and has several vents that you can open or close, depending on the temperature. I even bought one for my daughter for her recent birthday. You won't be making a mistake by purchasing this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: There is ZERO lining in this jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this jacket, as there is absolutely ZERO lining. My previous North Face jacket had a mesh lining, and this one is just completely plastic inside, which obviously is not comfortable and makes you hot and sticky.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight jacket. I usually wear Large in jackets, and I ordered an XL because I wasn't sure on the fit, and it is definitely larger than I'd like if I'm just wearing it over a T-shirt or something, but if you want to add layers like a sweatshirt underneath, order a size up like I did and it'd be perfect. There's the waxy lining inside, but it's not distracting. But it is thin! But stays dry, so it's great for layering but can get cold if you don't wear a lot under it. The hood is a great size too-covers your whole head no problem!
customer_reviews.author: Harleigh

customer_reviews.title: As usual with North Face: Size up.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 3x as I'm usually a size 22 and this is tight on the hip area. I should have gone with my initial thought of North Face running slim. I love the jacket, color and material, but I'm returning due to the fit in the hip. I couldn't find the 3x sizing information on the size chart which would have been helpful. I was a 58 in. hip.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Same coat as Columbia's Arcadia jacket but $40 more.
customer_reviews.text: Quality item but not worth the price. I bought this North Face jacket first then when it arrived I wore it and went to the store in town to compare it to the Columbia Arcadia II jacket and it is the same thing but more expensive. Plus this North Face doesn't have a interior liner, which is what I was concerned about. The Columbia version is better in my opinion because the liner keeps the clingy jacket off your skin if you're in a warmer climate and not wearing long sleeve's underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K.

customer_reviews.title: Basically like wearing a fancy plastic bag
customer_reviews.text: This jacket fit just okay, it didn't really fit well through the waist. The color was pretty spot on to what was displayed. But the main reason I returned it was the feeling of the jacket. It felt like wearing a stiff plastic bag, very uncomfortable. Didn't feel at all breathable, even with the pit zips open, and because it's unlined if you wear short sleeves under it's like wearing a plastic bag against your skin. That didn't work for running. Sent it back. Sad, because the color was great.
customer_reviews.author: Kaulika

customer_reviews.title: This coat is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This coat was put to the test in a very rainy backpacking trip. The hood has a small brim and has 2 ways to adjust (at the chin and a cinch at the back of the head. The wrists have velcro and there is a draw cord at the waist. There are zippers at the armpits for ventilation. This coat is strictly for rain and is not insulated. I wore it down to 50°F. It blocked the wind but at 50 and damp I began to get chilly. It would be perfect with a fleece under it at that temp. I had zero leaks with this coat, perfect rain coat.
customer_reviews.author: c.bear

customer_reviews.title: Great for warm weather climates that sometimes get rain.
customer_reviews.text: This rain jacket is exactly what I was looking for: super lightweight (it's an unlined shell), simple understated color (I bought the "grapevine color, which is sort of an army green) and not too sporty/athletic looking so I can wear it around the city without feeling wildly underdressed. I'm 5'5", weigh 140 lbs and I generally wear a size 6 or 8. I bought the medium size to allow for layering underneath and good movement in the shoulders and it's the perfect size. It's roomy but not boxy or shapeless.
customer_reviews.author: Tesee

customer_reviews.title: Impressive little rain jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Nice thin rain jacket. Really kept a lot of water off of me. We got stuck in New York when Hurricane Florince came through. Kept me dry from the thighs up. The Big pockets inside and out were very helpful to keep my stuff dry. And the armpit zippers were a blessing. The humidity was high.
customer_reviews.author: catbud

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: It’s a thinner jacket if that’s what you’re looking for. Works great for me , just need it to keep me dry while I’m out delivering mail & I tend to get too hot but this wasn’t too hot for me. Love the color combo & great price
customer_reviews.author: Adriane

customer_reviews.title: Awful plastic lining, sticks to your skin
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from north face. Fit is true to size, I normally wear medium tops and is what I ordered in this, —-it has a loose fit (which is what I wanted). My complaint is there is absolute no warmth to this jacket what so ever. Also, the plastic lining inside sticks to you and makes you sweat. If you wore a long sleeve shirt underneath it would probably be tolerable. But overall I highly dislike this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Love This Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this jacket. I took it with me to New York and the day we got there it was raining. The entire day. It wasn’t pleasant. But, I was wearing this jacket and it not only protected me from the rain, but it helped with the wind and kept me from getting cold. I love the look of this jacket and it’s very flattering! I couldn’t be more happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: brook

customer_reviews.title: Size up!
customer_reviews.text: You will most definitely want to size up at least 1 size. I usually wear an xl in almost everything.. shirts and sweat shirts. I got an xxl due to the reviews and I’m glad I did, fits perfectly! It’s not form fitting but it’s also not really loose to the point it looks baggy. If you are wanting to layer I would suggest going up two sizes as I think the xxl fits like a xl.
customer_reviews.author: BRITTANY

customer_reviews.title: Super cool 😎
customer_reviews.text: I love how u can make a storage case out of the jacket so I can keep it in my car if needed. I do Uber and postmates so while working sometimes it will start raining out of nowhere and having this jacket has been a huge help. Fits very well and the bright color helps me be seen so I don’t get in a hit and run accident lol. The hood is a lil small to me since I have very thick Locs but I have a bucket hat to help me add a lil surface area lol
customer_reviews.author: Pea money

customer_reviews.title: awesome lightweight rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This rain jacket is thin and lightweight It folds easily too. I love the fit. I got a small, and it fits perfectly.(I am 5’3” and thin, athletic build) It is great quality--NorthFace of course! Price on Amazon is terrific. At Dick’s Sporting it is $99 right now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Goldfarb

customer_reviews.title: Love this rain jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Took me a couple wears to figure out how to secure the elastic adjusters on the hood but it's actually a pretty smart little thing that holds it where you want it compared to the traditional ones where you'd have two strings dangling. Like any rain jacket in the summer it is a little warm when it's hot and raining but that's to be expected. I LOVE the deep, deep purple color I got even though I only chose that over black because black was so much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Lare

customer_reviews.title: Rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I have an old one, on the left picture, same exact style but it has a warm collar and inner lining and is much more comfortable to wear. The one on the right is the one I just bought but no warm collar or inner lining and is flimsy and not warm and comfortable. A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jan l

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this jacket
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this jacket. I can fold it and reduce it to nothing and throw it in my purse or backpack. Very light and practical. AND YES, it will protect you from the rain girls!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket but need to order up on size
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice jacket. I ordered a medium as I always take a med. or a size 10. The medium was too small. Barely fit around the hip area when zipped and the other parts around shoulders and waist were somewhat OK but would never allow for thicker clothing underneath. At least the Medium had good sleeve length as I have long arms. I reordered in a large and it is perfect. Not too big. So I recommend ordering a size larger than you usually order.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Douglas

customer_reviews.title: I’m think this is fake
customer_reviews.text: So this jacket is VERY THIN not as pictured I had this jacket from Northface store mines was heavier so i’m thinking it’s fake also the tag fail off easily the writing in Chinese writing also the inside pockets are not stitch correctly
customer_reviews.author: jellyfish

customer_reviews.title: not for my body
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'3", not overweight, but busty. A North Face medium is too narrow through the torso and the arms pull through the shoulders. I tried a large, which zips around me but the sleeves are way too long and the shoulders are too big. I have returned the jacket. It is attractive and well made, but clearly for someone straight up and down, not curvy.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Ryden

customer_reviews.title: Love  North Face
customer_reviews.text: Since I love North Face products, I ordered this rain jacket. Love the look. Love the neutral color and I'm sure it will keep me dry. ( Haven't had opportunity to wear yet.") Update: I wore this jacket last week when I had to be outside in what I consider a "monsoon". I was out in this rain for about 4 hours and I stayed completely dry. I could not believe this jacket was that good. The rest of me didn't fare so well, but I was so thankful I had my North Face jacket. I highly recommend. The other people in my group were soaked, but this jacket kept me dry.
customer_reviews.author: Janie S. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Big difference between medium and large.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one of these I owned. I loved the color of my original one(khaki), and this grey was a bit light in color, but works well. I initially ordered medium but was too tight to wear anything underneath except thin tee shirt. Ordered large and seem almost too big--but keeping it. Great lightweight packable rain jacket with arm pit zips--essential.
customer_reviews.author: Out there in the crazy world

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry
customer_reviews.text: The North Face quality stands up to it's claims. I had to go to the North Face web site to get a full description of the jacket. The arms are a little long, but I figure with a sweatshirt underneath, it will be fine. The fabric is a little 'crunchy' but it's not a problem when you are in a rainstorm, I won't hear it anyway. Thanks for making great products.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Great for short armed people!
customer_reviews.text: The North Face Women's Venture 2 Jacket - my main concern was long sleeves. I had already returned the Resolve because the sleeves were at least 4 inches too long! The Venture 2 has velcro wrists so you can adjust them and it fit perfectly. Loved this so much, I bought another and will be buying another next week in a larger size for the few days of cold we get in Florida, so I can wear long sleeves under it. LOVE this jacket - if you are a shorty like me - 5 foot - this would be perfect for you!
customer_reviews.author: PattyNJax

customer_reviews.title: Might be Fake?
customer_reviews.text: Returned this right away as I’m pretty sure it’s Counterfeit? Definitely did not look or feel like a $100 North Face Jacket. Super thin & poor quality material just didn’t seem right to me.
customer_reviews.author: Ashy

customer_reviews.title: It’s just a “shell”
customer_reviews.text: The color of the jacket (Ponderosa Green) is perfect, but the flimsy material is not. Decided to give it a whirl today, for part of the description states “100% wind proof”. Gusting at 36 mph, cold, with a snowstorm on the horizon... layered appropriately for an errand jaunt into town. The jacket was adequate, nothing out the ordinary.
customer_reviews.author: Ann S.

customer_reviews.title: Another great North Face jacket
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6" and 120 lbs w/ long arms, and the small fits perfectly. It's still roomy enough to wear layers underneath, including a lightweight, packable down jacket. My only criticism is that the care labels are sewn into the lining of an inside pocket, so you'd have to open seams to get to them. After washing this jacket, I recommend you follow the instructions for other North Face jackets - close all the zippers before washing. Otherwise, the (waterproof) pockets will fill w/ water.
customer_reviews.author: NC Dee

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit through bust.
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear an xsmall in all brands, including TNF but this jacket ran too small, especially in the chest. Sizing up would not work as the sleeves ran large. Pn my body the fit was very awkward as it was tight in the chest and somewhat tight in the hips but the shoulders and sleeves were quite loose. If you are busy you need to size up and take your chances with the sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: KLM

customer_reviews.title: Best rain jacket ever - Venture 2
customer_reviews.text: I like it even better than my (lost) Helly Hansen. Therefore, I bought one of these ultra-lightweight, packable, hair-covering-hood, airy, open arm- zip, good zipper, colorful jackets for every woman in my family. I bought them extra large for everybody, so they can wear fleece jackets underneath in cold weather. They are a traveler's dream. I only wish there were a reflector band or logo or something built in for night walks, but that is easily solved with a stick-on. These jackets are great, not inexpensive, not easy to find, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne H

customer_reviews.title: Worked splendidly all spring
customer_reviews.text: I live in a condo have to walk my dog - who doesn't mind drizzle or light rain - and this jacket fit well and kept me dry - and breathed surprisingly well. I have several North Face jackets and the brand name is partly why I bought this to replace a poncho thing that is way too long - gave it to a taller friend. But this works well and dries quickly enough - I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Mullarkey

customer_reviews.title: Great Rain Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket! It fits perfect and really kept the rain off and me dry. I was able to layer a sweatshirt and long sleeve under it with no problem. I bought it for a back packing trip through Germany and it worked great. Folded up small enough but really repelled water. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this jacket
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this jacket! It's super lightweight, easy to pack, and very very nicely fitting. Looks great. I'm 5'8", 130 lbs and 32DD and got a small and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and easy to layer. Rain stays off - a true waterproof product. The wonky reason I gave it 4 stars is that it makes a lot of noise if you’re walking when the arms brush against the sides. But I only wear it when it’s raining to get me to my car and back so it doesn’t bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! Vented armpits are the best! Good good even with a ponytail! Bought large, I’m 5’6 160lbs athletic, it’s baggy but can bundle with sweatshirts under with room. Walked my dog this morning for 2 hours in downpours in New England and totally dry!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rain jacket. I love the color!! It is bright, beautiful, and true to the display picture. The material is a little thin and it gets wrinkled easily. It is also pretty expensive. For those reasons I am giving it a 4/5. I sized up because I needed to layer it and I'm glad I did. Overall pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Not the same size as the previous model
customer_reviews.text: I wore out the last NF Venture raincoat, and an encounter with bed bugs forced me to wash it in high heat, which impacted the Gortex seam tape. I wanted something bright for the dreary Oregon rain and thought red would be fun. It's a bit on the orange side, but okay. The size is smaller from the previous jacket, not giving me the same room I had in the other one for layering. But, it just motivated me to eat healthy and drop some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Go a size bigger if you wear layers
customer_reviews.text: I use this for general rainy day wear. I’m 5’10” so arm length is very important. I ordered a XXL It’s long enough and roomy enough to wear layered with a sweater. I would like the body to be longer for more coverage. It just barely covers my back pockets. The zipper pockets have lots of room and secure well. I’ve stayed dry in a heavy rain but a bit more length would give better protection.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I immediately returned it. The fabric felt like plastic and not like fabric. It said it was slim fit and it wasn't. I was very disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: RFG

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Big But Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an extra large because my previous North Face rain jacket was a large and it was very tight. This one is just a bit big, but I still like it. I like the adjustable cuffs at the wrists and the zippers under the arms. Kept me dry in the last rainstorm
customer_reviews.author: seashell

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Great buy I have looked for a rain coat that I can zip over my chest that doesn’t make me look like a tent as well, I got a 2x and it was actually a 2x. It’s roomy without being over huge and I love the color it’s like a very light lavender. Very feminine would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Malatesta

customer_reviews.title: Great product. "Welded" seams can separate in dryer so ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. "Welded" seams can separate in dryer so would recommend washing by hand and air drying.
customer_reviews.author: Albert  Forget

customer_reviews.title: Best rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This jacket was perfect. It fit great, the hood stays up in the wind, it doesn't make too much noise when you walk. I also love that you can fold it up I to a bag and it's great for travelling! I also love that it's the North face brand that I trust.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sizing, love the color and keeps me warm ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sizing, love the color and keeps me warm and dry! Only complaint is that once the zipper is completely pulled up, it opens at the bottom (this should not happen on a $100 jacket!) and has happened more than once. May have to look into replacing the zipper....disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: North Face jacket not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Product material quality was lower than expected from a brand like the North Face. Garment feels like a plastic bag and uncomfortable next to bare skin.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this jacket for my business trips to Seattle. Life saver!!! Keeps wind and rain away. No umbrella needed. Bought my actual size and it fits well. If you want to wear a thick sweater underneath, is recommend that you go a size larger. Otherwise, fits nicely and flattering.
customer_reviews.author: Mel & Ken

customer_reviews.title: Size up and know it’s not a winter jacket but perfect for rain and layers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size up and after receiving it I was thankful i did. It’s a perfect fall jacket for rain or to wear with a sweatshirt underneath. For reference I am 5’10 and have boobs, hips and a but. It does feel like a glorified plastic bag but I sweat easy so I wanted something light and it’s prefect to wear layers.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Sarpong

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not fantastic for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: The fit is great, the color is awesome, but the actual water “resisting” was nothing more than subpar, I found myself still wet underneath the jacket after being in some decent rain. Expected more from the north face brand and with this price tag. It is super light and packable, won’t keep you warm but it does dry fast
customer_reviews.author: Peyton Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love the color!
customer_reviews.text: Very cute coat! I love the color & it works well to keep you dry. I’m 5 ft shirt & 93 lbs so the XS fits big, as I expected. There’s not really a fit to it, zero contour, but if you want to keep the rain off of you whether you’re wearing a sweater or more layers- this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Conner Bowd

customer_reviews.title: Love this lightweight waterproof jacket - perfect for running
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent lightweight, wind proof, and waterproof jacket for running in the rain. It kept me warm and dry, but it is breathable so I didn't get over heated. It was a rainy and quite windy day when I first tried it and the cold wind did not bother me at all. It kept the rain out so I was comfortable running 7 miles that day. I would highly recommend this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: lpufford

customer_reviews.title: Best rain jacket ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second NF jacket and will not be my last! The first one is still in good condition, but after 5 years I thought it was time for a different color. The Fire Brick Red (deep red orange) color I picked was true to picture shown. I'm 5'4" and what some call "THICK" but I chose small because I prefer a fitting fit. I am still able to layer with a sweater under. It keeps me dry on rainy days and always pack it in on mountain hikes!
customer_reviews.author: gisela

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she absolutely loved it. Great protection from the elements and made from high quality materials. I have one myself that I’ve worn for over 6 years and it’s still like new. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a light weight rain jacket and doesn’t want to have to buy another in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: motomarine0311

customer_reviews.title: Size up, runs small!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, sure to keep you dry! I'm glad I followed the recommendations of previous reviewers and sized up. I normally wear either a small or a medium so sized up to a large. Was expecting it to be quite loose in fit but it actually fits well other than the sleeves being long. I think a medium would have been too tight. Especially like that it's just long enough n the back to cover my rear!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn R.

customer_reviews.title: Great little all around jacket. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this jacket. This is my second one. We live in FL and transportation is frequently by boat in all kinds of weather. This jacket is great in both wind and rain. The hood fits well. Mine is white and it just always looks good. Make sure you read and follow washing instructions. That’s how I ruined my first one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Locascio

customer_reviews.title: Baggy
customer_reviews.text: The jacket was huge. It was not fitting. I felt as though it will allow too much air/wind to get through to even keep me warm. The arm was large, even after trying to use the velcro for the wrist. Returned it, I want someone more fitted to help retain my core temp.
customer_reviews.author: In-Senethavysouk Household

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket. It is very lightweight and perfect for my climate! Mobile, AL is a constant rain or drizzle. It has a breathable lining that vents well if I have to wear it all day. Which happens a lot. There are a lot of pockets and storage and ties. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: JillB

customer_reviews.title: color different from photo
customer_reviews.text: The color was sort of a mint-grey, not blue like the photo on Amazon and not pretty at all. The raincoat itself is great -- my son has the same model in a men's size. It's lightweight, packs well, has armpit zippers, and keeps him dry
customer_reviews.author: APL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect light weight jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light jacket. This is my second one. It hits just below hips and gives enough room to sit and move in. Arm slits are great for keeping cool. They hold up well, wash great and pack nice for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Cr Clawson-mullins

customer_reviews.title: Favorite windbreaker ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone gives me compliments on this jacket. I absolutely love it too. It’s lightweight but definitely keeps the cold wind out. It’s so darn cute too. Love the pastel color. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jen B

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket size up one or probably two sizes
customer_reviews.text: Seems really well made but runs small. I sized up because I wanted to be able to wear items underneath, but it’s still tight
customer_reviews.author: Chel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This jackets fit perfectly and it’s sizing matched up with most other things I order from North Face. It’s sizing matches what other brands I order from. It fits neatly in my luggage and is lightweight. There is enough room given the sizing to add another light layer to keep me warm when I do not want a bulky jacket. It’s my go to jacket when traveling, with exception to winter time.
customer_reviews.author: Kama Beaton

customer_reviews.title: Ladies’ jacket cut for ladies!
customer_reviews.text: The jacket material was not what I expected but is fine. It’s the first North Face women’s jacket that I’ve tried on that is cut for a woman’s shape. I’m slim but not young and all previous size L models were too snug for my taste. (I’m size 8-10 in slacks). So it’s very comfortable and I can put a sweater under it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Great overall jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and weight of this jacket. I like that it is vented and has Velcro to adjust the cuffs. Most of all I like that it can be easily folded/stuffed into a pocket/pouch that zips closed. It is very compact for travel. I haven’t had the opportunity to wear it in the rain yet to comment on how well it protects you from water.
customer_reviews.author: J1

customer_reviews.title: Runs small - Color not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size up to layer. RUNS SMALL. No room to layer. Color was navy, definitely not as pictured or described. Fabric makes loud crinkly noise. Overpriced. Will return.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, waterproof great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. Travelled to Ireland and wore it over a fleece and totally kept the rain out, but was breathable as well.
customer_reviews.author: CLE

customer_reviews.title: Great raincoat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a light weight rain coat at home and while on vacation in Hawaii. The jacket fits well, very breathable, and keeps me dry! I normally would get a small size (5'5", 135lbs) but sized up to a medium so it would fit during pregnany.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable North Face quality light weight rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: This dark grey, light weight North Face jacket is comfortable and professional looking/nice for work. (At least I think if I had a job, I'd look amazing at my job in this jacket). It's warm enough for 45+ degrees if you have a sweatshirt underneath (you might like that north face on bare chest look? 😂).
customer_reviews.author: Qwerty Mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: Love this rain coat, gorgeous burgundy color. The only thing I wish it was a little heavier. It’s just a shell, but I have room underneath for a hoodie or sweatshirt when it’s raining and cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rain Jacket
customer_reviews.text: As described. I did get the XL because I wanted it to be large enough to fit over a light jacket as it is not a warm rain coat so if it is rainy and cold, you may need something under. My shirt size is large or xl depending on the make.
customer_reviews.author: sdugger

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really nice...if it isn’t authentic north face then it’s a really good knock off...haven’t worn in the rain yet but the material feels waterproof. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality jacket and fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have not needed to wear this jacket yet I live in NC the season is here now for this jacket this is why I ordered now. Nice quality jacket and fits as expected. Will follow up once wore.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color, but extremely thin
customer_reviews.text: I love the color of this jacket, and the fit is perfect; however, for the price I was surprised at how thin it is and at the quality of the liner. The liner looks like cheap plastic. For the money, I expected a bit more in terms of quality.
customer_reviews.author: amiller

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold weather and very thin uncomfortable material.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket runs small with a slim/petite cut. The material feels like a plastic grocery bag. Note this is a shell only and does not have a liner. Would not recommend. The only redeeming quality was the nice color.
customer_reviews.author: Nifdy Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: dry from the elements, but just did not breath well enough
customer_reviews.author: igz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Iceland! Absolutely amazing! I would suggest ordering a size up from what you would normally wear though.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good summer jacket
customer_reviews.text: It's a nicely constructed jacket. Very light. Loved the color. It's perfect as a single layer, however it runs small enough not to allow for a fleece layer underneath. Had to return it. I wear an 8/10 and ordered the medium.
customer_reviews.author: trixietelemetry

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the high cost.
customer_reviews.text: Very thin .package was put in a box that was way to big. When I received the cheaply made super thin jacket it was all balled up look like it was kept in the bottom of a dirty cloth hamper . Not at all what I was expecting. Pictures show a travel bag .it doesn't come with it. Way over priced
customer_reviews.author: Dennis & Lynnette Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these for my daughters and as gifts for their friends and have always been happy with them. They are lightweight, unlined, breathable, and waterproof. They pack pretty well into a book bag or small pack.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Overall ok but i did return
customer_reviews.text: Runs a little small i would size up also its like thin plastic material so its like a thin thin rain jacket. Was expecting a fleece like lining
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking. This is cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Like wearing a piece of rubberized plastic. Cheap feeling. No lining at all. Feels disgusting on skin. Very expensive for what feels like a cheap poncho. Keep looking. You’ll find something better.
customer_reviews.author: Trina  Peddicord

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very nice jacket. I purchased a black one to give my child a green one that I bought. ( n they prefer to wear this one because of the color) I gave the jacket 4 stars because it’s definitely true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jacket, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is a nice, affordable rain jacket. I got it at a discounted price and so far it’s worked well in the rain. I wish it was a bit longer but for the price can’t be beat. Runs true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley S.

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight windbreaker/ rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a lightweight rain jacket. I ordered a little large for layering as it is a windbreaker/ rain jacket not lined. For the purpose I bought it to be a nice spring/fall jacket in Washington, it's great. I also loved the color variations.
customer_reviews.author: Chelan Wayrynen

customer_reviews.title: Soft, light, and pretty
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable! Cool in warm weather and a wind stopper in cooler weather. The underarm zip vents are awesome and the inner lining of the jacket doesn’t stick up my skin.
customer_reviews.author: gracie

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Was not what I expected. very thin fiber jacket. Fast refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Z Southern Cali USA

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and breathable.
customer_reviews.text: Got this jacket to sustain rainy season in the Caribbean and it's held up so far! I'm 5'0", 145 and got the medium because I like this a little baggy in case I want to layer, and it fits nicely. Even being so short this jacket fits at the waist well.
customer_reviews.author: Sayde

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I went with a large due to measurments and I really wish I bought a medium. This jacket is light weight and just a great wear.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice wind breaker. Was expecting a jacket. Came 3 days later than expected.
customer_reviews.author: ChefsLife

customer_reviews.title: North face jacket
customer_reviews.text: Happy with it other than the fit on the arms. It’s a bit tight, but overall satisfied. Grey is a great color — true to image
customer_reviews.author: F.P

customer_reviews.title: Good quality rain jacket in gorgeous color!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this jacket!!! I just got it yesterday, but I went on a run in the rain for quite a while and it works perfectly!! I adore the color of this jacket, as it's bright enough to add a pop of color to my outfit but still muted enough to go with everything. I love the zippers under the armpits, which help to cool my body off as I'm running. It's also has a self-stowing pocket which makes it so easy to carry around! So far, this jacket is great.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: This is the best jacket! I just took it backpacking in Colorado ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best jacket! I just took it backpacking in Colorado (summer) and it was the the perfect hiking jacket. I live in San Diego and it is light (and cute) enough to wear for a night beach walk. I would recommend this jacket to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: The North Face Women's Venture 2 Jacket
feature_bullets: RAINY ADVENTURES. Constructed with breathable yet waterproof fabric, this jacket features sealed seams and is designed to withstand backcountry storms. Styled for everyday use and easy to pack away when the weather clears up.

STAY DRY. This waterproof jacket is built to help keep you dry. A DryVent shell with a Durable Water-Repellent (DWR) finish helps keep you dry when rain strikes. Sealed seams help ensure that water stays out so the weather doesn't stop your day.

RELAXED FIT. Designed for versatile wear, this rain jacket is made with a relaxed fit with room for extra layers. A hem-cinch cord and adjustable hood offer a custom fit with extra coverage. Pit-zip venting adds breathability when you're on the move.
EASILY PACKABLE. You only need a handful of extra space in your pack to stash this ultralight, weatherproof rain shell for extra weather protection when storms are on the horizon.
SECURE STORAGE. Stowable in-hand pocket and covered secure zip hand pockets to protect your hands and valuables from the elements.
